intro: Descurainia richardsonii var. viscosa, commonly known as sticky rocket, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its sticky, glandular hairs that cover its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive texture. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its seeds are enclosed in siliques, typical of the family. This species is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
